question: Khalil Hashmi has been elected ad chairperson of the Annual Meeting of States Parties to the Convention on Certain Conventional Weapons (CCW). He is from which country?
explanation:
Ambassador Khalil Hashmi, Pakistan\'s Permanent Representative to the United Nations in Geneva, has been elected as Chairperson of the Annual Meeting of States Parties to the Convention on Certain Conventional Weapons (CCW). The Convention on CCW represents an important arms control framework that will prohibit and restrict certain conventional weapons that can cause unnecessary suffering to combatants or affect civilians indiscriminately.
Convention on CCW was signed on 10 April 1981 and came into effect on 2 December 1983. The convention seeks to restrict/prohibit the use of certain conventional weapons which are considered excessively injurious or whose effects are indiscriminate.
